pages.about: AquaRealm Boutique About Us: Pioneering the Aquatic Experience in Mumbai Since 2015 Home Catalog Our fish About us Contacts About AquaRealm Boutique: Our Passion for Aquatic Life Our Mission: Inspiring, Educating, and Connecting Aquatic Enthusiasts Nestled in the heart of Mumbai, AquaRealm Boutique embarked on its journey in 2015 with a singular vision: to transform the aquatic pet industry in India by providing a haven for both the aquarist community and those newly discovering the joys of aquarium keeping. Founded by a group of passionate aquarists, our boutique has become a symbol of quality, sustainability, and innovation in the realm of aquatic life. Our Mission At AquaRealm Boutique, our mission is threefold: To Inspire: We aim to ignite a passion for the aquatic world through our extensive selection of fish, plants, and aquarium setups. We believe every aquarium is a living art piece, capable of inspiring awe and curiosity. To Educate: Empowering our customers with knowledge is at the core of our mission. We strive to provide valuable insights into the care, maintenance, and environmental impact of aquariums, ensuring our community is well-informed and capable of making sustainable choices. To Connect: Building a community of like-minded enthusiasts is essential. We offer a space for aquarists to share their experiences, learn from each other, and grow together in their aquatic endeavors. Our Journey The inception of AquaRealm Boutique was driven by a lack of specialized aquarium stores in Mumbai that catered to both the aesthetic and ecological aspects of aquarium keeping. Our founders, with over two decades of combined experience in marine biology and aquascaping, sought to fill this gap. They envisioned a place where quality, beauty, and education converged, leading to the establishment of AquaRealm Boutique. Our Advantages Quality Selection: We pride ourselves on our stringent selection process. Each species and product in our store is carefully chosen for its health, beauty, and sustainability. Expertise: Our team comprises seasoned aquarists, marine biologists, and aquascape artists, offering unparalleled expertise and advice to our customers. Innovation: We stay at the forefront of the latest technologies and practices in aquarium maintenance and design, ensuring our customers have access to the best the industry has to offer. Community Focus: Beyond selling products, we host workshops, meet-ups, and seminars, fostering a vibrant community of aquatic enthusiasts. Sustainability: We are committed to eco-friendly practices, from promoting species that thrive in home aquariums without harming wild populations to using sustainable materials in our products. Why AquaRealm Boutique? Choosing AquaRealm Boutique means more than just buying fish or aquarium supplies. It means becoming part of a community that values the beauty and complexity of aquatic life. It means supporting a business that cares deeply about sustainability and education. Most importantly, it means embarking on a journey with trusted guides who are as passionate about the aquatic world as you are. Our Future Looking ahead, AquaRealm Boutique is committed to expanding our reach, both in terms of our physical presence and our online community. We envision a future where our boutique not only continues to serve the aquarists of Mumbai but also becomes a beacon for aquatic enthusiasts across India and beyond. With plans to introduce more rare and exotic species, cutting-edge aquascaping designs, and innovative aquatic solutions, the journey of AquaRealm Boutique is just beginning. Thank you for choosing to explore the underwater world with AquaRealm Boutique. Together, let's create breathtaking aquatic environments that inspire, educate, and bring joy to our lives. Welcome to our community, where the beauty of the aquatic world knows no bounds. pages.fish: AquaRealm Boutique Our Fish: Explore Our Diverse Aquarium Fish Collection Home Catalog Our fish About us Contacts AquaRealm Boutique's Exquisite Aquarium Fish Selection Meet Our Aquatic Stars: Detailed Profiles of Our Fish Welcome to the "Our Fish" section of AquaRealm Boutique, where we take pride in offering an extensive and meticulously selected range of aquarium fish. Each species in our collection is chosen for its beauty, uniqueness, and compatibility with home aquariums. We are dedicated to providing not just fish, but companions that bring tranquility and beauty to your space. Below, you'll find detailed descriptions of 10 of our most popular and fascinating species, each with its own unique charm and requirements. 1. Neon Tetra (Paracheirodon innesi) The Neon Tetra (Paracheirodon innesi) stands as a jewel in the freshwater aquarium hobby, captivating enthusiasts with its dazzling display of iridescent blue and vibrant red hues. This diminutive yet striking species has cemented its status as one of the most beloved freshwater fish, thanks to its vivid colors and dynamic presence in the aquatic community. Originating from the clear, warm waters of South America's Amazon basin, the Neon Tetra flourishes in environments that mimic these conditions, favoring slightly acidic to neutral water (pH levels between 6.0 and 7.0) and a temperature range of 72 to 76 degrees Fahrenheit (22 to 24 degrees Celsius). Neon Tetras are quintessentially social creatures, thriving best in schools of six or more. This schooling behavior is not just a survival instinct; it creates a breathtaking visual spectacle in the aquarium, with the fish moving in synchronized harmony, their colors reflecting and refracting light as they glide through the water. To witness a school of Neon Tetras in motion is to see the aquatic world's natural artistry at its finest. Their habitat preferences extend to the tank's physical environment as well. A tank rich in vegetation not only replicates the densely planted rivers of their native habitat but also provides the Neon Tetras with ample hiding spots and a sense of security. Floating plants and a dark substrate can enhance the vibrancy of their colors, making their blue and red hues stand out even more strikingly against the backdrop of a well-planted aquarium. In terms of compatibility, the peaceful nature of Neon Tetras makes them ideal candidates for community tanks. They coexist harmoniously with other non-aggressive species, contributing to a balanced and tranquil aquatic ecosystem. Their non-territorial demeanor and adaptability allow them to blend seamlessly into diverse community setups, making them a favorite among both novice and experienced aquarists. Caring for Neon Tetras requires attention to their dietary needs as well. A diet of high-quality flake food supplemented with small, live or frozen foods like brine shrimp or daphnia can ensure they receive the necessary nutrients for optimal health and coloration. Regular tank maintenance, including consistent water changes and monitoring of water quality, is essential to keep these delicate fish in peak condition. In summary, the Neon Tetra is more than just a fish; it is a living, swimming piece of art that brings a dynamic beauty to any freshwater aquarium. Its requirements for slightly acidic to neutral water, a vegetation-rich environment, and the company of its own kind, coupled with its peaceful temperament, make it a delightful addition to the aquarium community. Whether as part of a serene, planted setup or a bustling community tank, the Neon Tetra remains a testament to the enchanting possibilities of the underwater world. 2. Betta Fish (Betta splendens) The Betta Fish (Betta splendens), often referred to as the Siamese Fighting Fish, is a species that commands attention in the aquatic world with its breathtaking array of colors and dramatic finnage. Native to the still waters of Southeast Asia's rice paddies, ponds, and slow-moving streams, the Betta Fish has adapted to a variety of aquatic environments, but it thrives best in warm, stable conditions that mimic its natural habitat. The ideal temperature for these vibrant creatures ranges from 76 to 82 degrees Fahrenheit (24 to 28 degrees Celsius), a testament to their tropical origins. One of the most striking features of the Betta Fish is its remarkable fin structure, which can include types such as the veil tail, crown tail, halfmoon, and delta, among others. These fins flow around them like silk in the water, making them one of the most visually captivating species to observe. The Betta's color palette is equally impressive, with hues that span the spectrum from deep blues and reds to vibrant oranges, greens, and even pastel shades, often with iridescent highlights that catch the light beautifully. When setting up an aquarium for a Betta Fish, one must consider their unique needs and behaviors. A minimum tank size of 5 gallons is recommended to provide ample space for swimming and territories, along with a secure lid to prevent them from leaping out of their aquatic home—a surprising ability that speaks to their adaptability and intelligence. The environment should include a variety of plants and hiding spaces to mimic the cover they would seek in their natural habitat, contributing to their sense of security and well-being. Bettas are known for their territorial nature, particularly males, which exhibit a strong instinct to defend their space. This characteristic makes them best suited to solitary living in their aquariums, where they can reign without competition. However, with careful selection and observation, Bettas can coexist with certain species of peaceful, small fish, snails, and shrimp that do not intrude on their territory or compete for resources. It is crucial to avoid housing them with fin-nipping species or other males, as this can lead to stress and aggression. Dietarily, Betta Fish benefit from a varied regime that includes high-quality betta pellets as a staple, complemented by live or frozen foods such as brine shrimp, bloodworms, and daphnia. This not only provides them with essential nutrients for health and vitality but also encourages their natural hunting behaviors, adding another layer of engagement to their care. The Betta Fish's care involves more than meeting basic environmental and nutritional needs; it's about creating a space where their magnificent colors and personalities can shine. Regular maintenance, including water changes and monitoring for optimal water quality (pH levels ideally between 6.5 and 7.5), is essential to maintain their health and vibrancy. By understanding and respecting the Betta's natural behaviors and preferences, aquarists can ensure these stunning fish lead fulfilling lives as cherished members of the home aquarium. 3. Guppies (Poecilia reticulata) Guppies (Poecilia reticulata), with their vibrant colors and easygoing nature, are a staple in the freshwater aquarium hobby, especially favored by novice aquarists for their hardiness and minimal care requirements. These small, yet lively fish hail from the warm freshwater streams and lakes of South America but have adapted to a wide range of environments, showcasing their incredible resilience and adaptability. Their ability to thrive in a variety of water conditions makes them an excellent choice for those just beginning their aquarium journey. One of the most fascinating aspects of Guppies is their reproductive strategy; they are livebearers, which means they give birth to fully formed, free-swimming young rather than laying eggs. This reproductive trait makes Guppies particularly interesting to observe, as aquarists can witness the cycle of life unfold within their aquariums. However, it's important to manage their prolific breeding by maintaining a balanced ratio of males to females in the tank or by separating them, as their population can quickly increase, leading to overcrowding. Guppies are renowned for their dazzling array of colors and patterns, with males displaying more pronounced and diverse colorations compared to the more subdued hues of females. This sexual dimorphism not only adds a dynamic visual element to the aquarium but also aids in the easy identification of sexes. From brilliant blues and radiant reds to striking greens and yellows, the variety of colors and tail shapes available makes each Guppy uniquely captivating. While Guppies are generally peaceful and sociable, making them ideal inhabitants for community tanks, it's noteworthy that males may sometimes exhibit aggression towards each other, particularly in the presence of females. This behavior is typically a display of dominance or competition for mates and can be mitigated by providing ample space and hiding spots within the tank to reduce stress and territorial disputes. As omnivores, Guppies have a diverse diet that includes both plant-based and meaty foods. They will readily accept a wide range of foods, including flake food, freeze-dried bloodworms, and brine shrimp. To ensure their optimal health and color vibrancy, it's beneficial to provide a varied diet that encompasses all the nutrients they need. Regular feeding of small amounts, rather than large, infrequent feedings, can help prevent water quality issues and ensure the fish are receiving a balanced diet. Caring for Guppies involves more than just feeding and observing their colorful displays; it also includes maintaining their environment. They prefer water temperatures between 72 to 82 degrees Fahrenheit (22 to 28 degrees Celsius) and appreciate a tank with plenty of plants and open swimming areas. Regular water changes, monitoring of water parameters, and a well-filtered but gentle water flow will mimic their natural habitat conditions and support their well-being. In summary, Guppies are a delightful addition to any freshwater aquarium, offering a blend of beauty, resilience, and fascinating behavior. Their care requirements, while straightforward, provide an excellent foundation for understanding the basics of fishkeeping, making them a perfect choice for both novice and experienced aquarists alike. By creating a suitable environment and providing proper care, aquarists can enjoy the lively antics and stunning diversity of these charming fish 4. Angelfish (Pterophyllum scalare) Angelfish (Pterophyllum scalare) are among the most majestic and visually striking inhabitants of the freshwater aquarium world. Their distinctive triangular bodies, accentuated by long, flowing fins, and serene gliding movements, make them a captivating centerpiece in any aquatic setting. Originating from the slow-moving, densely vegetated waterways of the Amazon Basin in South America, Angelfish have adapted to thrive in a variety of aquarium conditions, provided their basic needs for space and environment are met. The elegant appearance of Angelfish is matched by their interesting behavior and social dynamics. As members of the cichlid family, they possess a complex range of behaviors and can exhibit territorial tendencies, especially during breeding times or when establishing hierarchy within the tank. This aspect of their nature necessitates thoughtful consideration when choosing tank mates. While Angelfish can coexist peacefully with a wide range of fish species, they are best paired with those that do not intrude on their vertical swimming space and are not small enough to be considered prey. For those aspiring to keep Angelfish, creating an environment that mimics their natural habitat is key to their well-being. They flourish in well-planted tanks that offer ample swimming space and hiding spots. Plants not only provide cover but also contribute to the maintenance of water quality and offer a naturalistic backdrop against which the Angelfish’s colors and patterns can truly stand out. The tank should be sufficiently large—minimum 55 gallons for a group—to accommodate their size and swimming behavior. The water conditions should be kept stable, with a temperature range of 76 to 86 degrees Fahrenheit (24 to 30 degrees Celsius), a pH between 6.0 and 7.5, and soft to moderately hard water. Angelfish are not particularly finicky eaters and will accept a broad diet that includes flakes, pellets, live, and frozen foods. A varied diet is crucial for maintaining their health and vibrant coloration. Live and frozen foods such as bloodworms, brine shrimp, and daphnia are particularly beneficial, providing protein-rich nutrients that support growth and vitality. However, care should be taken to ensure that their diet is well-balanced, avoiding overreliance on any single food source. Breeding Angelfish in the home aquarium can be a rewarding experience, as they exhibit fascinating parental behaviors, often guarding their eggs and fry with great diligence. For those interested in breeding, providing a conducive environment with optimal water conditions and a diet rich in nutrients is essential. The breeding pair will often select a flat surface, such as a leaf or a piece of décor, to lay their eggs, which offers a unique opportunity to observe the developmental stages of their offspring. In summary, Angelfish offer a blend of ethereal beauty, intriguing behavior, and the potential for aquarists to engage with the complexities of cichlid social structures and breeding. Their care, while requiring attention to tank conditions and diet, rewards the aquarist with a serene and majestic presence in the aquarium. By accommodating their needs for space, companionship, and environmental conditions, Angelfish can thrive and become the shimmering jewels of any freshwater aquarium ensemble. 5. Corydoras Catfish (Corydoras sp.) Corydoras Catfish, belonging to the genus Corydoras, are cherished by aquarists worldwide for their endearing personalities, peaceful nature, and invaluable role as the cleanup crew of the freshwater aquarium. These small, armored catfish hail from the soft, sandy riverbeds and floodplains of South America, where they have evolved to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Their adaptability and resilience make them an excellent choice for both novice and experienced aquarists looking to add a touch of both utility and charm to their community tanks. One of the most distinctive features of Corydoras Catfish is their armored plates, which run along their bodies. These plates provide protection against potential predators and the environment, making them hardy inhabitants capable of withstanding a range of conditions. Despite their armored appearance, Corydoras have a gentle demeanor, characterized by their social behavior and playful antics. Often seen rummaging through the substrate in groups, they are a testament to the dynamic life that thrives at the bottom of the tank. The care of Corydoras Catfish centers around replicating their natural habitat as closely as possible. A key aspect of this is the choice of substrate; soft, sandy substrates are preferred to mimic the riverbeds of their native environment. This not only caters to their natural digging behavior but also helps protect their delicate barbels (whisker-like sensory organs) from damage. Sharp or rough substrates can lead to abrasions, which could harm the Corydoras and potentially lead to infections. Corydoras Catfish are known for their peaceful coexistence with a wide variety of tank mates. Their non-aggressive nature makes them ideal candidates for community tanks, where they can often be found adding a layer of activity and interest to the lower regions of the aquarium. However, their sociable nature also means they thrive in the company of their own kind. Keeping them in groups of at least five or more allows for natural schooling behavior, providing security and encouraging more active and engaging behavior from these shy fish. Diet-wise, Corydoras Catfish are not particularly demanding, but they do appreciate a varied diet. Sinking pellets or wafers formulated for bottom feeders make an excellent base for their diet, ensuring that food reaches them despite the presence of more surface-oriented fish. Supplementing this with occasional live and frozen foods such as bloodworms, brine shrimp, and daphnia not only provides nutritional variety but also stimulates their natural foraging instincts, contributing to their overall well-being and satisfaction. In summary, Corydoras Catfish are a delightful addition to any freshwater aquarium, bringing with them a unique combination of utility, peacefulness, and playful charm. Their care requirements, focusing on a suitable substrate, group dynamics, and dietary diversity, are straightforward yet rewarding, offering aquarists the chance to observe some of the more subtle yet fascinating aspects of aquatic life. By ensuring these needs are met, aquarists can enjoy the company of these charming bottom dwellers for many years, watching them sift through the substrate and interact with their environment in their distinctive, endearing manner. pages.privacy: AquaRealm Boutique Privacy Policy: Safeguarding Your Data Home Catalog Our fish About us Contacts AquaRealm Boutique Privacy Policy: Our Commitment to Your Privacy Understanding Your Data Protection at AquaRealm Boutique At AquaRealm Boutique, we prioritize the privacy and security of our users' data above all else. This Privacy Policy delineates the nature of information we gather, its intended use, and our commitment to safeguarding it. Information Collection In our efforts to enhance user experience and service quality, we amass various types of information, which include: Contact Information: This encompasses details such as names, email addresses, and phone numbers that you provide upon registration or while making inquiries. Browsing Data: We track information related to your site visits, encompassing traffic patterns and location data. Financial Transactions: We document the details of transactions conducted on our platform, including purchases and payment history. Use of Information The collected information serves multiple purposes, such as to: Customize your browsing experience on our site. Improve the overall functionality and services available on our website. Streamline transaction and order management processes. Engage with you about promotional activities, special offers, and updates concerning our offerings. Information Sharing AquaRealm Boutique firmly adheres to the principle of not selling, trading, or otherwise transferring your personally identifiable information to external parties, with the exception of the following scenarios: To fulfill legal requirements. To defend our rights or property. To enforce our site policies. To collaborate with contractors and service providers who support our business operations, provided they agree to keep this information confidential and use it exclusively for the agreed-upon purposes. Data Protection We implement a variety of security strategies to ensure the protection of your personal information. Nevertheless, it's crucial to recognize that no method of digital transmission or storage is infallible. Cookies To improve user experience, our website utilizes cookies. You may adjust your browser settings to decline cookies or to notify you when cookies are sent. Policy Updates AquaRealm Boutique reserves the discretionary right to amend this privacy policy as needed. Any changes will be prominently posted on the homepage of our website.
